The UddÄnas of the Fourth Part of the Sixth Chapter on the Aggregates of Attainment, there are twelve minds, namely: wholesome mind, unwholesome mind, obscured-neutral mind, non-obscured-neutral mind bound to the desire realm, wholesome mind, obscured-neutral mind, non-obscured-neutral mind bound to the form realm, wholesome mind, obscured-neutral mind, non-obscured-neutral mind bound to the formless realm, mind of one still learning, and mind of one beyond learning.ğŸ”½If wholesome mind bound to the desire realm ceases not to be accomplished and is accomplished, is it the same for unwholesome mind?ğŸ”½If unwholesome mind ceases not to be accomplished and is accomplished, is it the same for wholesome mind bound to the desire realm?
If wholesome mind bound to the desire realm ceases not to be accomplished and is accomplished, is it the same up to mind of one beyond learning?

If the non-learner mind loses non-accomplishment and attains accomplishment, does the wholesome mind of the desire realm also do the same?ğŸ”½Up to if the learner mind loses non-accomplishment and attains accomplishment, does the non-learner mind also do the same?
If the non-learner mind loses non-accomplishment and attains accomplishment, does the learner mind also do the same?
If the wholesome mind of the desire realm loses non-accomplishment and attains accomplishment, does the unwholesome mind also do the same?
There are four possibilities for the wholesome mind of the desire realm losing non-accomplishment and attaining accomplishment, but not the unwholesome mind, and so on in detail.

The wholesome mind of the desire realm loses non-accomplishment and attains accomplishment, but not the unwholesome mind, refers to when the wholesome roots are renewed.ğŸ”½The unwholesome mind loses non-accomplishment and attains accomplishment, but not the wholesome mind of the desire realm, refers to when one has already abandoned craving for the desire realm, and then falls back from the state of having abandoned craving.

The wholesome mind of the desire realm loses non-accomplishment and attains accomplishment, and so does the unwholesome mind, refers to when one dies in the form or formless realms and is reborn in the desire realm.
If it is not the case that wholesome thought of the realm of desire is not yet abandoned and becomes established, and also not unwholesome thought, it is excluded from the above characteristics.
If wholesome thought of the realm of desire is not yet abandoned and becomes established, is wholesome thought of the realm of desire also thus?

Or wholesome thought of the realm of desire is not yet abandoned and becomes established, but wholesome thought of the realm of desire is not thus. The four alternatives are explained in detail.ğŸ”½Wholesome thought of the realm of desire is not yet abandoned and becomes established, but wholesome thought of the realm of desire is not thus. When the wholesome roots are renewed.ğŸ”½Wholesome thought of the realm of desire is not yet abandoned and becomes established, but wholesome thought of the realm of desire is not thus. When ordinary beings who have already abandoned craving of the realm of desire fall back from the abandonment of craving.

Wholesome thought of the realm of desire is not yet abandoned and becomes established, and wholesome thought of the realm of desire is also thus. When beings of the realm of form and the formless realm are reborn in the realm of desire.
Neither does one who does not obtain the wholesome mind of the desire realm also not obtain the obscured-neutral mind of the desire realm excludes the above characteristics.
If one does not obtain the wholesome mind of the desire realm and obtains the unwholesome mind of the desire realm, does one also not obtain the unobscured-neutral mind of the desire realm?

Either one does not obtain the wholesome mind of the desire realm and obtains the unwholesome mind of the desire realm, but not the unobscured-neutral mind of the desire realm, and so on, with four possibilities in full.ğŸ”½One does not obtain the wholesome mind of the desire realm and obtains the unwholesome mind of the desire realm, but not the unobscured-neutral mind of the desire realm refers to when the wholesome roots are restored, and when one dies in the form realm and is reborn in the desire realm.ğŸ”½One does not obtain the unobscured-neutral mind of the desire realm and obtains the unwholesome mind of the desire realm, but not the wholesome mind of the desire realm refers to when one dies in the formless realm and is reborn in the form realm.

One does not obtain the wholesome mind of the desire realm and obtains the unwholesome mind of the desire realm, and also the unobscured-neutral mind of the desire realm refers to when one dies in the formless realm and is reborn in the desire realm.
If one does not abandon and acquire the wholesome mind of the desire realm, and also not the unwholesome and unobscured-neutral mind of the desire realm, it excludes the above characteristics.
If one abandons and acquires the wholesome mind of the desire realm, it is definitely not the wholesome mind of the form realm.
If one abandons and acquires the wholesome mind of the form realm, it is definitely not the wholesome mind of the desire realm.
If one abandons and acquires the wholesome mind of the desire realm, does it also apply to the obscured-neutral mind of the form realm?
There are four possibilities for abandoning and acquiring the wholesome mind of the desire realm and the obscured-neutral mind of the form realm.

Abandoning and acquiring the wholesome mind of the desire realm but not the obscured-neutral mind of the form realm refers to when the wholesome roots are restored, and when passing away from the form realm and being born in the desire realm.

As for the phrase â€œwhen one neither acquires nor sheds the wholesome thought of the realm of desire,â€ this refers to the first moment of wholesome thought in one who is born in the formless realm.ğŸ”½As for the phrase â€œwhen one neither acquires nor sheds the unwholesome and the two indeterminate thoughts,â€ this refers to the first moment of thought in one who is born in the realm of desire and who has not yet accumulated karma that will cause the arising of a thought of the realm of form.

As for the phrase â€œwhen one neither acquires nor sheds the obscured indeterminate thought of the realm of form,â€ this refers to the first moment of thought in one who is born in the realm of desire and who has not accumulated karma that will cause the arising of a thought of the realm of form.ğŸ”½As for the phrase â€œwhen one neither acquires nor sheds the unobscured indeterminate thought of the realm of form,â€ this refers to the first moment of thought in one who is born in the realm of desire and who has not accumulated karma that will cause the arising of a thought of the realm of form.ğŸ”½As for the phrase â€œwhen one neither acquires nor sheds the unobscured indeterminate thought of the formless realm,â€ this refers to the first moment of thought in one who is born in the realm of desire and who has not accumulated karma that will cause the arising of a thought of the formless realm.

As for the phrase â€œwhen one neither acquires nor sheds the thought of neither-perception-nor-non-perception,â€ this refers to the first moment of thought in one who is born in the realm of desire and who has not accumulated karma that will cause the arising of a thought of the summit of existence.

If a wholesome mind is relinquished and not yet acquired, is a formless-realm obscured-neutral mind also relinquished and not yet acquired?ğŸ”½If a formless-realm obscured-neutral mind is relinquished and not yet acquired, a wholesome mind is also relinquished and not yet acquired.
Or a wholesome mind is relinquished and not yet acquired while a formless-realm obscured-neutral mind is not relinquished and not yet acquired.
If a wholesome mind is relinquished and not yet acquired, is a formless-realm unobscured-neutral mind also relinquished and not yet acquired?
Or a wholesome mind is relinquished and not yet acquired while a formless-realm unobscured-neutral mind is not relinquished and not yet acquired. The four sentences are explained in detail.

A wholesome mind is relinquished and not yet acquired while a formless-realm unobscured-neutral mind is not relinquished and not yet acquired. When one who has already abandoned desire for the form realm falls back from that state of separation from desire, and when one who has died in the form realm is reborn in the desire realm.

The phrase â€œthe obtaining of the wholesome and unwholesome thought of the realm of desire is not the nonobtaining of the thought of the realm of desireâ€ refers to the thought of the realm of desire that is neither wholesome nor unwholesome.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthe nonobtaining of the wholesome and unwholesome thought of the realm of desire is not the obtaining of the thought of the realm of desireâ€ refers to the thought of the realm of desire that is neither wholesome nor unwholesome.

The phrase â€œthe obtaining of the wholesome and unwholesome thought of the realm of desire is the nonobtaining of the thought of the realm of desireâ€ refers to the thought of the realm of desire that is neither wholesome nor unwholesome.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthe nonobtaining of the wholesome and unwholesome thought of the realm of desire is not the obtaining of the thought of the realm of desireâ€ excludes the above cases.ğŸ”½If there is the obtaining of the unwholesome thought and the nonobtaining of the wholesome thought of the realm of form, there is definitely not the nonobtaining of the wholesome thought of the realm of form and the obtaining of the unwholesome thought of the realm of form.

If there is the nonobtaining of the wholesome thought of the realm of form and the obtaining of the unwholesome thought of the realm of form, there is definitely not the obtaining of the wholesome thought of the realm of form and the nonobtaining of the unwholesome thought of the realm of form.

If there is the nonobtaining of the wholesome thought of the realm of form and the obtaining of the unwholesome thought of the realm of form, is there also the nonobtaining of the obscured-indeterminate thought of the realm of form and the obtaining of the unwholesome thought of the realm of form?ğŸ”½There are four cases:
Obtaining the unwholesome thought and not the obscured-indeterminate thought of the realm of form.

As for the acquisition of the wholesome thought of the realm of desire and the non-acquisition of the obscured-neutral thought of the realm of form, when one who has already abandoned craving of the realm of desire but not yet abandoned craving of the realm of form falls back from the abandonment of craving of the realm of desire, and when one who has died in the formless realm is reborn in the realm of desire.ğŸ”½As for the acquisition of the obscured-neutral thought of the realm of form and the non-acquisition of the wholesome thought of the realm of desire, when one who has already abandoned craving of the realm of form falls back due to the bonds of the realm of form, and when one who has died in the formless realm is reborn in the realm of form.

As for the acquisition of the wholesome thought of the realm of desire and the obscured-neutral thought of the realm of form, when one who has already abandoned craving of the realm of form falls back due to the bonds of the realm of desire, and when one who has died in the formless realm is reborn in the realm of desire.
As for neither the acquisition of the wholesome thought of the realm of desire nor the non-acquisition of the obscured-neutral thought of the realm of form, this excludes the above characteristics.
If a non-virtuous mind is abandoned and not yet attained, it is definitely not a formless realm-connected obscured neutral mind or a formless realm-connected wholesome mind.
If a form realm-connected unobscured neutral mind and a formless realm-connected wholesome mind are abandoned and not yet attained, it is definitely not a non-virtuous mind.
If a non-virtuous mind is abandoned and not yet attained, is a formless realm-connected obscured neutral mind also like this?
Or a non-virtuous mind is abandoned and not yet attained, but not a formless realm-connected obscured neutral mind. The four alternatives are explained in detail.

A non-virtuous mind is abandoned and not yet attained, but not a formless realm-connected obscured neutral mind, refers to those who have already abandoned desire realm attachment, learners and ordinary beings, when falling back from detachment from desire realm attachment, and when dying in the form and formless realms and being reborn in the desire realm.

As for the phrase â€œa wholesome mind of the formless realm is acquired and a non-obscured-neutral mind of the formless realm is not,â€ this refers to the case where an arhat, having aroused the fetters of the form realm or formless realm, falls back again.

As for the phrase â€œa non-obscured-neutral mind of the formless realm is acquired and a wholesome mind of the formless realm is not,â€ this refers to the case where an arhat, having aroused the fetters of the desire realm, falls back again.

As for the phrase â€œneither a wholesome mind of the formless realm is acquired nor a non-obscured-neutral mind of the formless realm is not,â€ this excludes the above cases.ğŸ”½If a wholesome mind of the formless realm is acquired and a non-obscured-neutral mind of the formless realm is not, then a non-obscured-neutral mind of the formless realm and a mind of one beyond training are definitely not acquired.
If a non-obscured-neutral mind of the formless realm and a mind of one beyond training are acquired, then a wholesome mind of the formless realm is definitely not acquired.
If a wholesome mind of the formless realm is acquired, then a learnerâ€™s mind is also acquired.
Or, a non-good mind may be abandoned without attainment and attained without accomplishment, but not a learner's mind. The four sentences are explained in detail.

A non-good mind is abandoned without attainment and attained without accomplishment, but not a learner's mind, refers to those who have already separated from desire for the desire realm, who are learners or ordinary beings, when they fall back from separation from desire, and when they die in the form or formless realms and are reborn in the desire realm.

A learner's mind is abandoned without attainment and attained without accomplishment, but not a non-good mind, refers to when an arhat, giving rise to the bonds of the form or formless realms, falls back again, and when entering the path of seeing through cultivating the preparations.

A non-good mind is abandoned without attainment and attained without accomplishment, and also a learner's mind, refers to when an arhat, giving rise to the bonds of the desire realm, falls back again.
Neither a non-good mind is abandoned without attainment and attained without accomplishment, nor a learner's mind, refers to excluding the above characteristics.
If a bound to the desire realm obscured neutral mind is abandoned without attainment and attained without accomplishment, is a desire realm bound uncovered neutral mind also like that?

Or, when one who is free from attachment to the desire realm loses and acquires the obscured indeterminate mind of the desire realm, but not the unobscured indeterminate mind of the desire realm, the four sentences are explained in full.ğŸ”½Losing and acquiring the obscured indeterminate mind of the desire realm but not the unobscured indeterminate mind of the desire realm refers to when ordinary beings who have already become free from attachment to the desire realm fall back from freedom from attachment to desire, and when they die in the form realm and are reborn in the desire realm.ğŸ”½Losing and acquiring the unobscured indeterminate mind of the desire realm but not the obscured indeterminate mind of the desire realm refers to when one dies in the formless realm and is reborn in the form realm.

Losing and acquiring both the obscured indeterminate mind of the desire realm and the unobscured indeterminate mind of the desire realm refers to when one dies in the formless realm and is reborn in the desire realm.
Neither losing and acquiring the obscured indeterminate mind of the desire realm nor the unobscured indeterminate mind of the desire realm refers to all the above cases.
If one discards and acquires the unwholesome thought associated with the desire realm, one definitely does not discard and acquire the wholesome thought associated with the form realm.
If one discards and acquires the wholesome thought associated with the form realm, one definitely does not discard and acquire the unwholesome thought associated with the desire realm.
If one discards and acquires the unwholesome thought associated with the desire realm, does one also discard and acquire the obscured-neutral thought associated with the form realm?
There are four possibilities for discarding and acquiring the unwholesome thought associated with the desire realm and the obscured-neutral thought associated with the form realm.

Discarding and acquiring the unwholesome thought associated with the desire realm but not the obscured-neutral thought associated with the form realm refers to ordinary beings who have already abandoned the craving of the desire realm but have not yet abandoned the craving of the form realm, when they fall back from the abandonment of craving upon retrogressing from the detachment of the desire realm, and when they are reborn in the desire realm after passing away from the form realm.

The phrase â€œa state in which the wholesome thought of the form realm is acquired but the obscured-neutral thought of the realm of desire is notâ€ refers to the time when one who has already abandoned the craving of the form realm produces the fetters of the form realm and then falls back, and to the time when one who has died in the formless realm is reborn in the form realm.

The phrase â€œa state in which the wholesome thought of the form realm is acquired and the obscured-neutral thought of the realm of desire is alsoâ€ refers to the time when one who has already abandoned the craving of the form realm and is an ordinary person produces the fetters of the realm of desire and then falls back, and to the time when one who has died in the formless realm is reborn in the realm of desire.
The phrase â€œa state in which the wholesome thought of the form realm is acquired but the obscured-neutral thought of the realm of desire is notâ€ refers to all the above cases.
If there is a state in which the obscured-neutral thought of the realm of desire is acquired but not lost, then the unobscured-neutral thought of the form realm is not lost.
If one abandons and obtains a formless realm unobscured-neutral mind, one definitely does not abandon and obtain a desire realm obscured-neutral mind.
After this, there is nothing at all.
If one abandons and obtains a desire realm unobscured-neutral mind, does one also abandon and obtain a form realm wholesome mind?

Either one abandons and obtains a desire realm unobscured-neutral mind but not a form realm wholesome mind, and so on, with four alternatives in all.ğŸ”½Abandoning and obtaining a desire realm unobscured-neutral mind but not a form realm wholesome mind refers to when one falls from the formless realm and is born in the desire realm.
Abandoning and obtaining a form realm wholesome mind but not a desire realm unobscured-neutral mind refers to when one cultivates practices and a form realm wholesome mind first appears.

When there is abandonment of acquisition of a wholesome mind of the desire realm and acquisition of a wholesome mind of the form realm, it is when one who has fallen from the formless realm is reborn in the form realm.

When there is neither abandonment of acquisition of a wholesome mind of the desire realm nor acquisition of a wholesome mind of the form realm, it is excluded from the above cases.ğŸ”½When there is abandonment of acquisition of a wholesome mind of the desire realm and acquisition of a wholesome mind of the form realm, there is definitely abandonment of acquisition of a wholesome mind of the form realm.

Or when there is abandonment of acquisition of a wholesome mind of the form realm and acquisition of a wholesome mind of the desire realm, it is when one who has already abandoned desire for the form realm falls back from the state of having abandoned desire for the form realm.

If there is abandonment of acquisition of a wholesome mind of the desire realm and acquisition of a wholesome mind of the form realm, is there also abandonment of acquisition of an unwholesome mind of the form realm?ğŸ”½Or when there is abandonment of acquisition of an unwholesome mind of the form realm and acquisition of a wholesome mind of the form realm, it is when one who has already abandoned desire for the form realm falls back from the state of having abandoned desire for the form realm.ğŸ”½Or when there is abandonment of acquisition of a wholesome mind of the form realm and acquisition of an unwholesome mind of the form realm, it is when one who has already abandoned desire for the form realm falls back from the state of having abandoned desire for the form realm.
Or when there is neither abandonment of acquisition of a wholesome mind of the form realm nor acquisition of an unwholesome mind of the form realm, it is excluded from the above cases.

When one discards the unwholesome thought of the desire realm and acquires the wholesome thought of the form realm, one does not discard the unwholesome thought of the form realm and acquire the wholesome thought of the formless realm.ğŸ”½When one discards the unwholesome thought of the form realm and acquires the wholesome thought of the formless realm, one does not discard the unwholesome thought of the desire realm and acquire the wholesome thought of the formless realm.

When one discards the unwholesome thought of the desire realm and acquires the wholesome thought of the formless realm, one does not discard the unwholesome thought of the form realm and acquire the wholesome thought of the formless realm.ğŸ”½When one discards the unwholesome thought of the desire realm and acquires the wholesome thought of the formless realm, one does not discard the unwholesome thought of the form realm and acquire the wholesome thought of the formless realm.ğŸ”½When one discards the unwholesome thought of the desire realm and acquires the wholesome thought of the formless realm, one does not discard the unwholesome thought of the form realm and acquire the wholesome thought of the formless realm.

When one discards the unwholesome thought of the desire realm and acquires the wholesome thought of the formless realm, one does not discard the unwholesome thought of the form realm and acquire the wholesome thought of the formless realm.
After this, there is nothing at all.
If there is abandonment and attainment of wholesome minds bound to the form realm, is there also abandonment and attainment of obscured-neutral minds bound to the form realm?

There are four possibilities for abandoning and attaining wholesome and obscured-neutral minds bound to the form realm.ğŸ”½Abandoning and attaining wholesome minds bound to the form realm but not obscured-neutral minds bound to the form realm refers to when one cultivates practices and wholesome minds bound to the form realm first appear.ğŸ”½Abandoning and attaining obscured-neutral minds bound to the form realm but not wholesome minds bound to the form realm refers to when one has already abandoned craving for the form realm, and when falling back from the state of having abandoned craving for the form realm, and when passing away from the formless realm and being born in the desire realm.

Abandoning and attaining both wholesome minds bound to the form realm and obscured-neutral minds bound to the form realm refers to when passing away from the formless realm and being born in the form realm.
Neither does one who does not acquire and lose the wholesome mind of the form realm necessarily acquire and lose the obscured-neutral mind of the form realm. Excluding the above cases.
If one acquires and loses the wholesome mind of the form realm, does one also acquire and lose the unobscured-neutral mind of the form realm?

Either one acquires and loses the wholesome mind of the form realm but not the unobscured-neutral mind of the form realm, and so on, with four possibilities in full.ğŸ”½One acquires and loses the wholesome mind of the form realm but not the unobscured-neutral mind of the form realm refers to when one cultivates practices and the wholesome mind of the form realm first appears.ğŸ”½One acquires and loses the unobscured-neutral mind of the form realm but not the wholesome mind of the form realm refers to when one attains detachment from the desire realm.
One acquires and loses both the wholesome mind of the form realm and the unobscured-neutral mind of the form realm refers to when one falls from the formless realm and is reborn in the form realm.

When not abandoning and acquiring the wholesome mind of the form realm, and also not the unobscured-neutral mind of the form realm, it excludes the above characteristics.ğŸ”½If one abandons and acquires the wholesome mind of the form realm, it is definitely not the wholesome mind of the formless realm.
If one abandons and acquires the wholesome mind of the formless realm, it is definitely not the wholesome mind of the form realm.
From this point on, there is nothing at all.ğŸ”½When abandoning and acquiring the obscured-neutral mind of the form realm, is it also the unobscured-neutral mind of the form realm?
Either abandoning and acquiring the obscured-neutral mind of the form realm but not the unobscured-neutral mind of the form realm, and so on, explaining the four alternatives in detail.

As for the phrase â€œwhen one neither regresses nor advances, one neither discards nor acquires the wholesome thought of the formless realm,â€ this refers to the situation in which one is abiding in a formless realm thought and neither regressing nor advancing.ğŸ”½As for the phrase â€œwhen one discards the wholesome thought of the formless realm but does not acquire the unwholesome and nondetermined thoughts of the formless realm,â€ this refers to the situation in which one is abiding in a wholesome thought of the form realm and discards the wholesome thought of the formless realm.ğŸ”½As for the phrase â€œwhen one discards the unwholesome and nondetermined thoughts of the formless realm but does not acquire the wholesome thought of the formless realm,â€ this refers to the situation in which one is abiding in a wholesome thought of the desire realm and discards the unwholesome and nondetermined thoughts of the formless realm.

As for the phrase â€œwhen one discards the wholesome thought of the formless realm but does not acquire the unwholesome and nondetermined thoughts of the formless realm,â€ this refers to the situation in which one is abiding in a wholesome thought of the desire realm and discards the wholesome thought of the formless realm.

As for the phrase â€œwhen one discards the unwholesome and nondetermined thoughts of the formless realm but does not acquire the wholesome thought of the formless realm,â€ this refers to the situation in which one is abiding in a wholesome thought of the form realm and discards the unwholesome and nondetermined thoughts of the formless realm.ğŸ”½As for the phrase â€œwhen one discards the wholesome thought of the formless realm but does not acquire the unwholesome and nondetermined thoughts of the formless realm,â€ this refers to the situation in which one is abiding in a wholesome thought of the desire realm and discards the wholesome thought of the formless realm.

As for the phrase â€œwhen one discards the unwholesome and nondetermined thoughts of the formless realm but does not acquire the wholesome thought of the formless realm,â€ this refers to the situation in which one is abiding in a wholesome thought of the form realm and discards the unwholesome and nondetermined thoughts of the formless realm.ğŸ”½As for the phrase â€œwhen one discards the wholesome thought of the formless realm but does not acquire the unwholesome and nondetermined thoughts of the formless realm,â€ this refers to the situation in which one is abiding in a wholesome thought of the desire realm and discards the wholesome thought

If one abandons the non-accomplishment and achieves the accomplishment of wholesome minds belonging to the formless realm, it is definitely not the case that one abandons the non-accomplishment and achieves the accomplishment of obscured-neutral minds belonging to the form realm.

If one abandons the non-accomplishment and achieves the accomplishment of obscured-neutral minds belonging to the form realm, does one also abandon the non-accomplishment and achieve the accomplishment of obscured-neutral minds belonging to the formless realm?

There are four possibilities for abandoning the non-accomplishment and achieving the accomplishment of obscured-neutral minds belonging to the form realm, and so on.ğŸ”½Abandoning the non-accomplishment and achieving the accomplishment of obscured-neutral minds belonging to the form realm, but not obscured-neutral minds belonging to the formless realm, refers to those who have already abandoned craving for the form realm, whether learners or ordinary beings, when they fall back from the abandonment of craving for the form realm, and when those in the formless realm are reborn in the desire realm.

Abandoning the non-accomplishment and achieving the accomplishment of obscured-neutral minds belonging to the formless realm, but not obscured-neutral minds belonging to the form realm, refers to arhats when they fall back from the bonds of the formless realm.

The phrase â€œthose who both discard and acquireâ€ refers to the arhat who, having aroused the fetters of the realm of desire or the realm of form, falls back to a lower stage.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthose who neither discard nor acquireâ€ refers to all other cases.

The phrase â€œthose who discard and acquireâ€ refers to those who discard the obscured-neutral thought of the realm of form and acquire the unobscured-neutral thought of the realm of formlessness.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthose who neither discard nor acquireâ€ refers to all other cases.

The phrase â€œthose who discard and acquireâ€ refers to those who discard the obscured-neutral thought of the realm of form and acquire the unobscured-neutral thought of the realm of formlessness.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthose who neither discard nor acquireâ€ refers to all other cases.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthose who discard and acquireâ€ refers to those who discard the obscured-neutral thought of the realm of form and acquire the thought of training.
The phrase â€œthose who neither discard nor acquireâ€ refers to all other cases.

The phrase â€œa nonlearner mind that is not acquired and then lostâ€ refers to a learner or an ordinary being who has already abandoned attachment to the form realm. It also refers to one who has fallen back from the state of having abandoned attachment to the form realm, and to one who has died in the formless realm and been reborn in the desire realm or the form realm.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œa learner mind that is not acquired and then lostâ€ refers to an arhat who has fallen back from the state of having been afflicted by the passions of the formless realm, and to one who has entered the path of insight through the practice of applied practices.

The phrase â€œa formless realm obscured neutral mind that is not acquired and then lostâ€ refers to an arhat who has fallen back from the state of having been afflicted by the passions of the desire realm or the form realm.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œa nonlearner mind that is not acquired and then lostâ€ refers to all remaining cases not specified above.
If a form realm unobstructed indeterminate mind is not acquired and then lost, a formless realm wholesome mind is definitely not acquired and then lost.
If one abandons and obtains the wholesome mind of the formless realm, one definitely does not have the unobscured-neutral mind of the form realm.
After this, there is nothing at all.ğŸ”½If one abandons and obtains the wholesome mind of the formless realm, one definitely does not have the obscured-neutral mind of the formless realm.
If one abandons and obtains the obscured-neutral mind of the formless realm, one definitely does not have the wholesome mind of the formless realm.

After this, there is nothing at all.ğŸ”½If one abandons and obtains the obscured-neutral mind of the formless realm, one definitely does not have the unobscured-neutral mind of the formless realm or the mind of one beyond training.ğŸ”½If one abandons and obtains the unobscured-neutral mind of the formless realm or the mind of one beyond training, one definitely does not have the obscured-neutral mind of the formless realm.
If one abandons and obtains the obscured-neutral mind of the formless realm, the learner's mind is definitely so.

Or, when one who is cultivating the path of insight discards the unaccomplished state and attains the accomplished state of a learner's mind, one does not discard the unaccomplished state and attain the accomplished state of a formless realm obscured neutral mind.ğŸ”½If one discards the unaccomplished state and attains the accomplished state of a formless realm unobscured neutral mind, one definitely does not discard the unaccomplished state and attain the accomplished state of a learner's mind or a post-learner's mind.

If one discards the unaccomplished state and attains the accomplished state of a learner's mind or a post-learner's mind, one definitely does not discard the unaccomplished state and attain the accomplished state of a formless realm unobscured neutral mind.ğŸ”½If one discards the unaccomplished state and attains the accomplished state of a learner's mind, one definitely does not discard the unaccomplished state and attain the accomplished state of a post-learner's mind.

If one discards the unaccomplished state and attains the accomplished state of a post-learner's mind, one definitely does not discard the unaccomplished state and attain the accomplished state of a learner's mind.
